content.text: Shade **one** more small square so that the diagram has one line of symmetry.
Shade **one** more small square so that the diagram has rotational symmetry of order 2.
(a) Find the actual distance between village \(P\) and village \(Q\).
Measure the bearing of village \(Q\) from village \(P\).
The scale drawing shows the positions of two villages, \(P\) and \(Q\).
The scale is 1 cm represents 0.5 km.
The diagram shows two straight lines intersecting two parallel lines.
Find the value of \(x\) and the value of \(y\).
Find the probability that she picks an odd number.
Calculate the number of times Samira is expected to pick an odd number.
Samira picks one of these cards at random and replaces it.
(b) Describe fully the single transformation that maps triangle \(T\) onto triangle \(U\).
Find the next term of this sequence.
Find the \(n\)th term of this sequence.
These are the first 4 terms of a sequence.
Find the highest common factor (HCF) of 36 and 54.
Find the coordinates of the point \(C\).
Give your answer in standard form.
\(P, Q\) and \(R\) lie on a circle. \(QR\) is a diameter.
Find angle \(PRQ\). Give geometrical reasons for your answer.
The diagram shows a sector of a circle, centre \(O\). The length of the arc is \(n\pi \mathrm{~cm}\).
Work out an estimate of the mean.
Complete the histogram to show the information in the table.
The table shows information about the time taken by each student to solve the puzzle.
On the grid, draw a cumulative frequency diagram.
Use your cumulative frequency diagram to find an estimate for
80 adults solve the same puzzle as the students.
The cumulative frequency table shows information about the time taken by each adult to solve the puzzle.
The diagram shows a solid made by joining a hemisphere to a cylinder. The radius of both the hemisphere and the cylinder is 6 cm. The height of the cylinder is 5 cm.
Find the total surface area of the solid. Give your answer in terms of \(\pi\) .
Give your answer in its simplest form.
Find the value of \(c\) and the value of \(k\).
Write as a single fraction in its simplest form.
The diagram shows the graph of \(y=3 x-x^{3}\) . The graph crosses the \(x\)-axis at \(A\), at \(O\) and at \(B\). The turning points of the graph are at \(P\) and at \(Q\).
(a) Find the \(x\)-coordinate of \(A\) and the \(x\)-coordinate of \(B\). Give your answers as exact values.
When \(x\) is increased by a factor of 4, the value of \(y\) changes by a factor of \(p\).
Write down the exact value of \(\tan 60^{\circ}\).
In the diagram, \(O A\) is parallel to \(B C\).
The position vector of \(A\) is \(\mathbf{a}\) and the position vector of \(B\) is \(\mathbf{b}\).
Give your answer in terms of \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{b}\), in its simplest form.
The line \(y=7 x+3\) intersects the curve \(y=x^{2}+5 x-12\) at the points \(A\) and \(B\).
